text: Psalm 59
A Prayer for Protection
For the \add music\add* director, \add according to\add* Do Not Destroy.
Of David. A miktam.

When Saul dispatched \add men\add* and they watched the house to kill him.\f + \fr Ps 59 \ft The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm; the English verse number is reduced by one \f*
Deliver me from my enemies, O my God.
Protect\f + \fr 59:1 \ft The sense is that of making something inaccessibly high, like a fortress \f* me from those who rise up against me.
Deliver me from workers of iniquity,
and from men of bloodshed save me.
For look, they lie in wait for my life.\f + \fr 59:3 \ft Hebrew “soul” \f*
The mighty attack\f + \fr 59:3 \ft Or “stir up strife” \f* against me,
not \add because of\add* my transgression or my sin, O Yahweh.
Without guilt on my part they run and ready themselves.
Awake to meet me and see.
And you, Yahweh, God \add of\add* hosts, \add are\add* the God of Israel.
Rouse yourself to punish all the nations.
Do not be gracious to any \add who\add* treacherously plot evil. \qs Selah\qs*
They return at evening; they howl like dogs\f + \fr 59:6 \ft Hebrew “dog” \f*
while they prowl \add the\add* city.
Look, they pour out \add talk\add* with their mouth.
Swords \add are\add* on their lips,
for \add they say\add*, “Who hears?”
But you, O Yahweh, will laugh at them;
you will mock all \add the\add* nations.
O my strength,\f + \fr 59:9 \ft Reading with a few Hebrew manuscripts and the LXX, Targum and v. \xt 17 \ft \f* I will watch for you,
because \add you\add*, O God, \add are\add* my (high) stronghold.
My\f + \fr 59:10 \ft According to the reading tradition (\fqa Qere \ft ), some Hebrew manuscripts and the LXX \f* God of loyal love will meet me;
God will cause me to look \add in triumph\add* on my enemies.
Do not kill them, lest my people forget.
Make them \add to\add* wander by your power,
and bring them down, O Lord, our shield.
\add By\add* the sin of their mouth \add and\add* the words of their lips,
even in their pride, let them be trapped,
and for \add the\add* curses\f + \fr 59:12 \ft Hebrew “curse” \f* and lies\f + \fr 59:12 \ft Hebrew “lie” \f* they proclaim.
Destroy in anger; destroy so they are no more,
so that they may know that God \add is\add* ruling in Jacob
to the ends of the earth. \qs Selah\qs*
They return at evening; they howl like dogs\f + \fr 59:14 \ft Hebrew “dog” \f*
while they prowl \add the\add* city.
As for them, they wander for food.
If they are not satisfied, then they continue all night.\f + \fr 59:15 \ft Or “then they growl” \f*
But as for me, I will sing \add of\add* your strength,
and I will hail your loyal love in the morning,
because you have been my \add high\add* stronghold
and a refuge in my ⸤time⸥\f + \fr 59:16 \ft Literally “day” \f* of trouble.
O my strength, to you I will give praise,
because God \add is\add* my \add high\add* stronghold,
my God of loyal love.
